description.narrative: (Ghana): The Financing Ghanaian Agriculture Project (FinGAP) supports Feed the Future by addressing a key constraint within the Ghanaian commercial agriculture sector, which is access to finance. Increased access to finance enables needed investments in agricultural value chains. With FY 2016 funds, FinGAP will continue to increase agricultural investments through expanding the number of viable investment opportunities. It will increase financial institutions' appetite for agricultural-related loans. FinGAP will support the Partnership for Growth Initiative for increased access to credit. Activities include working with the Government of Ghana to enhance supervision and regulation of capital markets. Furthermore, due to high interest rates on bank debt, the project promotes alternative financing sources. The project also raises awareness among Ghanaian firms of the benefits that come from raising capital through alternative stock markets...
